title: Speaker Embeddings to Improve Tracking of Intermittent and Moving Speakers
author: Taous Iatariene (Orange Innovation), Can Cui (University de Lorraine, CNRS, Inria, Loria), Alexandre Guerin (Orange Innovation), Romain Serizel (University de Lorraine, CNRS, Inria, Loria), ...
relevance_why: The paper explores the use of speaker embeddings for improving speaker tracking, which could inform techniques in audio analysis and enhance speaker recognition tasks that Dr. Liu is developing.
background: Tracking multiple intermittent and moving speakers in a noisy and reverberant environment, especially when speakers change position during inactivity.
contribution: This paper introduces a post-tracking identity reassignment method using speaker embeddings to enhance tracking performance, achieving improved accuracy in speaker identity assignment.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on spatial localization for tracking speaker identities but struggled with intermittent and moving speakers.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves tracking by integrating speaker embeddings derived from enhanced audio signals, thus enabling more robust identity verification.

key_innovation: Combines speaker embeddings with spatial information from tracking systems to reassess and correct identity assignments in real-time.
real_world_impact: Enhancements in tracking capabilities can significantly improve applications in automated transcription, surveillance, and speech recognition in crowded or dynamic environments.
limitations: The paper does not discuss the potential computational overhead of integrating embeddings in real-time processing.

new_terms.beamforming: **Beamforming** is a signal processing technique that uses multiple microphones to enhance signals coming from specific directions while reducing background noise.
new_terms.speaker embeddings: **Speaker embeddings** are numerical representations of a speaker’s voice characteristics that can be used for tasks like identification and verification.
